Hi Princewill, I’m sure if you read this set piece slowly with a positive attitude, you will definitely understand it much better. The writer isn’t talking politics, rather he emphasize on taking opportunity when it arises. Common man you talk about can’t leave by food alone ok. 
Did you ask yourself while the U.S. delegates attending the ceremony include President Barack Obama along with 26 Congress members and with every living U.S. president with the sole exception of George H W Bush? and the Canadian delegates including Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper, along with former Canadian Prime Ministers Kim Campbell, Jean Chretien and Brian Mulroney. Joe Clark, another ex PM of Canada, joining the Canadian delegation from the Ivory Coast where he has been on a mission promoting democracy? Mandela isn’t an ordinarily man, and if he is, he definitely stays in the kitchen when the pressure was high. So with due respect to your opinion this type of memorial comes once in a decade, and every words from the writer is absolutely right. We need a positive attitude from every Nigerian to get it working in the right paths. Cheers. delemayo
